alert.note: Alert for Coastal Dixie; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Taylor; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Dixie; Inland Taylor; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 23 at 8:35PM EDT until June 24 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 115 possible. * WHERE...Coastal Jefferson, Inland Dixie, Coastal Wakulla, Inland Taylor, Lafayette, Coastal Taylor, Coastal Dixie and Coastal Franklin Counties. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Dixie; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Jefferson; Coastal Taylor; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Dixie; Inland Taylor; Lafayette
